NASA's Parker Solar Probe has come
closer to the Sun than any previous
spacecraft and broken speed records
while doing so making it the fastest
vehicle ever to travel in space at a
blazing 213 thousand miles an hour
Parker Solar will execute 24 total
flybys of the Sun Tess is the exoplanet
hunter a NASA MIT led mission in search
of exoplanets orbiting the brightest

Falcon 9 rocket in April 2018 it now
orbits earth high above the planet
focusing on stars visible from the
northern ecliptic hemisphere Landsat 8
the most advanced earth selfie-stick in

Geological Survey
it is the seventh successful satellite
in the Landsat family which has been

of the Earth's surface

interior of the Red Planet the Landers
title is short for interior exploration
using seismic investigations geodesy and
heat transport which conveniently
summarizes its approach to the task and
also hints at the logistical complexity
of exploring beneath the surface of even
our nearest planetary neighbor
the Hubble Space Telescope a long-term
space-based observatory located 340
miles above Earth surface launched
aboard the space shuttle Discovery in
1990 as a collaboration between the
European Space Agency and NASA Hubble's
ultra sensitive cameras and
spectrographs point outward toward the
universe to collect both the visible
light rays that are ordinarily distorted
by passing through Earth's atmosphere
and a range of other wavelengths that
can't be detected from Earth the twin
Voyager 1 and 2 spacecraft has spent the
past four decades traveling farther from
the earth than any human made object has
ever gone though their primary mission
was to investigate the rings and moons
of Jupiter and Saturn their chip was
extended past these planets in order to
get a glimpse interstellar space
